intro: Voluntary muscles are attached to the skeleton to allow movement.
notes: Muscle Belly: The thick part of the muscle that contracts.
Tendon: Tough, non-elastic fibers that join Muscle to Bone.
Origin: The point where muscle joins a stationary bone (Humerus).
Insertion: The point where muscle joins a movable bone (Radius/Ulna).

hotspots.label: Biceps
hotspots.info: The flexor muscle on the front of the arm.

hotspots.label: Triceps
hotspots.info: The extensor muscle on the back of the arm.

hotspots.label: Tendon
hotspots.info: Connects the biceps muscle to the radius bone.
